alert.note: Alert for Tavaputs Plateau (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 5:12PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Garfield and western Rio Blanco Counties through 600 PM MDT... At 511 PM MDT, meteorologists and satellite imagery were tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles southeast of Dinosaur to 18 miles south of Rangely to 31 miles northwest of Fruita. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Satellite imagery. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Rangely around 525 PM MDT. This includes the following highways... Colorado 64 between mile markers 9 and 26, and near mile marker 50. Colorado 139 between mile markers 21 and 72. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
